channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Who will pay to replace Baltimore's Key Bridge? The legal battle has already begun
item.description: Workers are still removing pieces of the Key Bridge from Baltimore Harbor, but the fight over who will pay to replace it has already begun. Past accidents offer some clues about how it could play out.
item.content:encoded:
Workers are still removing pieces of the Key Bridge from Baltimore Harbor, but the fight over who will pay to replace it has already begun. Past accidents offer some clues about how it could play out.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Amazon, Target and other retailers pull weighted infant sleepwear over safety fears
item.description: Federal regulators, medical experts and safe-sleep advocates have warned of the potential danger of weighted infant sleepwear, but manufacturers say their products have helped millions of families.
item.content:encoded: Federal regulators, medical experts and safe-sleep advocates have warned of the potential danger of weighted infant sleepwear, but manufacturers say their products have helped millions of families.
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: House passes bill aimed to combat antisemitism amid college unrest
item.description: House Speaker Mike Johnson met with a group of Jewish students at Columbia University who say they've experienced antisemitic speech and harassment from protesters on and off campus.
item.content:encoded:
House Speaker Mike Johnson met with a group of Jewish students at Columbia University who say they've experienced antisemitic speech and harassment from protesters on and off campus.

(Image credit: Alex Kent)
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: After downsizing healthcare for years, Pentagon says medical readiness was a casualty
item.description: Former combat surgeons warn it won't be easy to restore medical readiness to where it was during the last war, much less where is needs to be for the next one.
item.content:encoded: Former combat surgeons warn it won't be easy to restore medical readiness to where it was during the last war, much less where is needs to be for the next one.
item.dc:creator: Quil Lawrence

item.title: Voters in this 'boomerang' county say they're nostalgic for the Trump economy
item.description: Voters in Northampton County, Pa., say they remember having more money when Donald Trump was in office. But when it comes time to cast their ballots this year, other issues are at play too.
item.content:encoded:
Voters in Northampton County, Pa., say they remember having more money when Donald Trump was in office. But when it comes time to cast their ballots this year, other issues are at play too.

(Image credit: Asma Khalid)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: Who is Keith Davidson, the lawyer who negotiated hush money payments from Trump?
item.description: Attorney Keith Davidson, a key witness who represented Stormy Daniels and Karen McDougal, will go back on the stand Thursday morning to continue testifying against Trump in New York.
item.content:encoded: Attorney Keith Davidson, a key witness who represented Stormy Daniels and Karen McDougal, will go back on the stand Thursday morning to continue testifying against Trump in New York.
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: College student explores rare mental health condition in award-winning podcast
item.description: This year's winning entry is an emotional account of living with schizoaffective disorder, from a student at Miami Dade College.
item.content:encoded: This year's winning entry is an emotional account of living with schizoaffective disorder, from a student at Miami Dade College.
item.dc:creator: Elissa Nadworny

item.title: U.S. v. Google: As landmark 'monopoly power' trial closes, here's what to look for
item.description: Is Google an illegal monopoly that's thwarted rivals to remain on top or is it simply a beloved search engine? Now it's up to the judge to decide.
item.content:encoded:
Is Google an illegal monopoly that's thwarted rivals to remain on top or is it simply a beloved search engine? Now it's up to the judge to decide.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Dara Kerr

item.title: Newly elected prime minister in Solomon Islands is likely to keep close China ties
item.description: Solomon Islands lawmakers elected former Foreign Minister Jeremiah Manele as prime minister Thursday in a development that suggests the South Pacific island nation will maintain close ties with China.
item.content:encoded: Solomon Islands lawmakers elected former Foreign Minister Jeremiah Manele as prime minister Thursday in a development that suggests the South Pacific island nation will maintain close ties with China.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Colombia's president says ammunition has gone missing from 2 army bases
item.description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro said Tuesday that hundreds of thousands of pieces of ammunition have gone missing from two military bases in the South American country.
item.content:encoded:
Colombian President Gustavo Petro said Tuesday that hundreds of thousands of pieces of ammunition have gone missing from two military bases in the South American country.

(Image credit: Fernando Vergara)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
